name: tots-c! The Officialist TigerJ Stream Companion!
name_original: tots-c! The Officialist TigerJ Stream Companion!
description:
t.o.t.s.-c.! The Officialist TigerJ Stream Companion

Welcome to the EXTREMELY early access page for tots-c! (pronounced "tot-see")

What is tots-c?

tots-c is a companion app for the TigerJ game jam streams (https://www.twitch.tv/tiger_j). It allows you to browse the archive of streamed game jam games with links to the games, their streamed moments (highlights) and other cool stuff!

How do I use this?

A web version is currently being developed which will appear Is at the top of this page, and a downloadable version is available for windows and linux. A mac version is on the way too. Simply download and unzip/run the program, or click "Run Magical Thingy" on the web player. 

There is a button on the top right to switch between the archive of streamed games and the live queue.

I feel like there is lag, it doesn't seem to update instantly..

Yup! it checks for a new json file every minute for the live queue. The file is written based off the current live queue every 5 minutes. So there will be a small amount of delay.

Why is this a thing?

In the olden days, many moons ago, I used to use public spreadsheets and manually maintained the queue by copy and pasting from chat. A few years ago I changed this to an automated process using bots, but the downside is I implemented a database instead of using spreadsheets which inadvertently disabled the ability for any viewers to see and/or interact with the queue(s). tots-c restores the ability for viewers to engage with the submission list and archive. 

There is a bug what do I do..?

Comment in the community thread: https://itch.io/t/2012018/suggestions-and-bugs
